aston.group20.model

Class AirControlTower

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.group20.model.AirControlTower

  • public class AirControlTower
extends java.lang.Object
    The Air Control Tower class manages the queues containing the active aircraft; it ensures that the aircraft within the queues are sorted correctly based on the strategy comparator that was passed through from the Airport class.
    Version:
    1.0, March 2014
    Author:
    Group_20

    • Field Summary

      private java.util.PriorityQueue<IAircraft> outgoing 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AirControlTower(Strategy strategy)
      Creating a new AirControlTower, which will initialise the queues and set the strategy for how to manage the Incoming aircraft.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      This method is used to clear the queues and the counter; it is called from the Simulator class when we want to reset the Simulation.
      void finish()
      This method is called from the Simulator class after the Simulation has finished.
      java.util.PriorityQueue<IAircraft> getBrokenDown()
      Accessor method to return the queue containing the Broken Down Aircraft.
      Counter getCounter()
      Accessor method to return the Counter which holds the statistics and is used to produce the end report.

      Accessor method to return the queue containing the Incoming Aircraft.
      java.util.PriorityQueue<IAircraft> getOutgoing()
      Accessor method to return the queue containing the Outgoing Aircraft.
      void setSeed(int seed)
      This method is used to set the seed of the random number generator, so that the Simulation results are reproducible.
      void step()
      This method is called from the Airport class; it iterates through the queues, calling the step method of each individual Aircraft; depending on the state of the Aircraft it may move Aircraft from the outgoing queue to the broken down queue and vice versa.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AirControlTower

        public AirControlTower(Strategy strategy)
        Creating a new AirControlTower, which will initialise the queues and set the strategy for how to manage the Incoming aircraft.
        Parameters:
        strategy - determines how the Incoming Aircraft will be sorted.
        See Also:
        and concrete subclasses to see the different ways of sorting incoming aircraft.

    • Method Detail

      • step

        public void step()
        This method is called from the Airport class; it iterates through the queues, calling the step method of each individual Aircraft; depending on the state of the Aircraft it may move Aircraft from the outgoing queue to the broken down queue and vice versa. It may also remove Aircraft from the Incoming queue if the plane does not have enough fuel left to land, that is if they have crashed. It will perform/call the appropriate methods in all cases.
        See Also:
        Aircraft.step()

      • finish

        public void finish()
        This method is called from the Simulator class after the Simulation has finished. The method ensures that all of the planes still in the queues are accounted for in the end report through the counters increment/set methods.
        See Also:
        Counter.incrementWaitingTime(int)

      • getIncoming

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<IAircraft> getIncoming()
        Accessor method to return the queue containing the Incoming Aircraft.
        Returns:
        the queue of Incoming Aircraft.

      • getCounter

        public Counter getCounter()
        Accessor method to return the Counter which holds the statistics and is used to produce the end report.

        the Counter.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        This method is used to clear the queues and the counter; it is called from the Simulator class when we want to reset the Simulation.

      • setSeed

        public void setSeed(int seed)
        This method is used to set the seed of the random number generator, so that the Simulation results are reproducible.
        Parameters:
        seed - the seed used for the random number generator (gen).
